com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.exceptions

Class ClientCreationFailedException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.exceptions.NetComRuntimeException
            • com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.exceptions.ClientCreationFailedException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ClientCreationFailedException
extends NetComRuntimeException
    This Exception is thrown, if the AbstractConnection.setup method encounters an Exception

    This means, that the Socket's OutputStream used for the SendingService is faulty or not connected. Normally this should not happen. It will however most likely happen, if you provide your own Socket within ServerStart.setServerSocketFactory(com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.interfaces.Factory)! Therefore, if you encounter this Exception, check you implementation of the ServerSocketFactory.

    Note, this Exception may contain multiple Exceptions. After the first Exception is encountered, the AbstractConnection tries to close its internally saved Socket using Socket.close(). This may throw another IOException. Those Exceptions are suppressed within the first encountered Exception.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    See Also:
    AbstractConnection.setup, SendingService.setup(java.io.OutputStream, java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue), ReceivingService.setup(com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.shared.clients.Connection, com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.shared.Session), Serialized Form
